newsitem.title: USA: Santa Fe Intl jumps in market debut.
newsitem.headline: Santa Fe Intl jumps in market debut.

text.p: Shares of contract driller Santa Fe International Corp jumped nearly 14 percent in early trading after their market debut in the largest initial public offering so far this year.
The shares opened up 4-1/4 to 32-3/4. They had been indicated at $30 to $33, and earlier at $32 to $34. The shares priced late Monday at $28.50, above a forecast range of $24 to $27.
Analysts had expected strong premiums, but the price was even higher than anticipated. The number of shares was raised to 35 million from 30 million at the last minute.
The offering is raising roughly $997.5 million, topping the previous high for a 1997 IPO -- Hertz Corp's $438 million offering in April.
Santa Fe Internatioanl was the most active stock on the New York Stock Exchange, with more than 8.3 million shares traded early in the session.
The shares were sold by Kuwait Petroleum Corp Trading sources familiar with the deal said the IPO was heavily oversubscribed, perhaps as much as eight times.
Santa Fe operates 51 offshore and land rigs in 16 countries and has the largest fleet of heavy-duty harsh environment jackup rigs in the world, plus three deepwater semisubmersible rigs.
